actions.text: Referred to House Committee on House Administration.
Reported to House from the Committee on House Administration with amendment, H. Rept. 96-41.
Measure called up as privileged matter in House.

official_title: A resolution to provide funds for the expenses of investigations to be conducted by the Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce.

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on House Administration with amendment, H. Rept. 96-41) Authorizes expenditures, not to exceed $3,708,000, by the House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce for investigations and studies. Prohibits any part of such funds from expenditure in connection with the study of any subject being investigated for the same purpose by any other House committee. Terminates the authorization granted by this resolution on January 3, 1980.

titles.title: A resolution to provide funds for the expenses of investigations to be conducted by the Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce.
